name: outrush
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a sudden movement of something out of somewhere: If the hole hadn't been plugged, there would have been an outrush of air. The problems in these countries did not lead to a dollar out-rush as had been seen in previous crises.
More examplesFewer examplesThey looked across the valley at the outrush of pumped water from the mine entrance.The only way to stem the outrush of US jobs is to demand that products made overseas meet the same standards as US factories.The problems in these countries did not lead to a dollar outrush as had been seen in previous crises.
